intro: Bataprine hispidula, commonly known as the hairy bataprine, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in umbels, and display a range of colors from white to pink. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
